direction: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
substeps: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)

direction: Mix butter, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, poppy seeds, and dried onion in a bowl.
substeps: Mix butter, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, poppy seeds, and dried onion in a bowl

direction: Separate the tops from the bottoms of the rolls; arrange the bottom pieces in a layer in the prepared baking dish. Layer about 1/2 of the ham onto the rolls; add a layer of Swiss cheese and top with remaining ham slices.
substeps: Separate the tops from the bottoms of the rolls
arrange the bottom pieces in a layer in the prepared baking dish
Layer about 1/2 of the ham onto the rolls
add a layer of Swiss cheese and top with remaining ham slices

direction: Place the tops of the rolls onto the sandwiches. Pour mustard mixture evenly over the rolls
substeps: Place the tops of the rolls onto the sandwiches
Pour mustard mixture evenly over the rolls

direction: Bake in the preheated oven until the rolls are lightly browned and the cheese has melted, about 20 minutes. Slice into individual rolls through the ham and cheese layers to serve.

bake.until: the rolls are lightly browned and the cheese has melted

substeps: Bake in the preheated oven until the rolls are lightly browned and the cheese has melted, about 20 minutes
Slice into individual rolls through the ham and cheese layers to serve
